storyTitle: As Manager, I want to set task deadlines to achieve timely task completion

testCases.title: Validate setting a valid future deadline
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
User has permission to create tasks
Task creation page is accessible
System time is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Navigate to task creation page
steps.expectedResult: Task creation form is displayed with all required fields including deadline date and time input fields

steps.action: Enter a valid future date/time as deadline (e.g., tomorrow's date at 5:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: The deadline field accepts the input, displays the entered date/time correctly, and no validation errors are shown

steps.action: Fill in other required task fields (task name, description, assignee)
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept valid input without errors

steps.action: Submit the form by clicking the Create/Save button
steps.expectedResult: Task is created successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and user is redirected to task details or task list page

steps.action: Verify the deadline is displayed in the task details view
steps.expectedResult: The specified deadline date and time is correctly displayed in the task details section

steps.action: Navigate to the task list view
steps.expectedResult: The newly created task appears in the list with the deadline visible and correctly formatted

postconditions: Task is successfully created in the system
Deadline is stored in the database with correct future date/time
Deadline is visible to all authorized users in task views
Task can be edited or deleted by authorized users

testCases.title: Verify rejection of past deadline
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
User has permission to create tasks
Task creation page is accessible
System time is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Navigate to task creation page
steps.expectedResult: Task creation form is displayed with all required fields including deadline date and time input fields

steps.action: Enter a past date/time as deadline (e.g., yesterday's date or earlier today)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed indicating that deadline cannot be in the past (e.g., 'Deadline must be a future date and time')

steps.action: Fill in other required task fields (task name, description, assignee)
steps.expectedResult: All other fields accept valid input, but deadline validation error remains visible

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form by clicking the Create/Save button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked, form is not submitted, error message remains visible or is highlighted, and user remains on the task creation page

steps.action: Correct the deadline by entering a valid future date/time
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message disappears, deadline field shows valid state

steps.action: Submit the form again
steps.expectedResult: Task is created successfully with the corrected deadline

postconditions: No task is created with past deadline
System maintains data integrity by preventing invalid deadline entries
User understands the validation requirement through clear error messaging
After correction, task is successfully created with valid deadline

testCases.title: Validate modifying deadline with valid future date
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
User has permission to edit tasks
At least one task exists in the system with a deadline
Task edit page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to an existing task and open the task edit page
steps.expectedResult: Task edit form is displayed with current task details including the existing deadline

steps.action: Modify the deadline to a different valid future date/time
steps.expectedResult: The deadline field accepts the new input, displays the updated date/time correctly, and no validation errors are shown

steps.action: Submit the form by clicking the Update/Save button
steps.expectedResult: Task is updated successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and the modified deadline is saved

steps.action: Verify the updated deadline in task details view
steps.expectedResult: The new deadline date and time is correctly displayed, replacing the previous deadline

steps.action: Check the task list view
steps.expectedResult: The updated deadline is reflected in the task list with correct formatting

postconditions: Task deadline is successfully updated in the system
Previous deadline is replaced with the new valid deadline
Updated deadline is visible to all authorized users
Task modification is logged in system audit trail

testCases.title: Verify rejection of past deadline during task modification
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
User has permission to edit tasks
At least one task exists in the system with a deadline
Task edit page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to an existing task and open the task edit page
steps.expectedResult: Task edit form is displayed with current task details including the existing deadline

steps.action: Modify the deadline to a past date/time
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed indicating that deadline cannot be in the past

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form by clicking the Update/Save button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked, form is not submitted, error message remains visible, and user remains on the task edit page

steps.action: Verify that the original deadline remains unchanged in the database
steps.expectedResult: Task retains its original deadline, no changes are persisted

postconditions: Task deadline remains unchanged
System prevents invalid deadline modification
Data integrity is maintained
User receives clear feedback about validation failure

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to assign priority levels to tasks to achieve effective task prioritization

testCases.title: Validate selection of valid priority levels
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
User has permission to create tasks
Task creation page is accessible
Priority dropdown contains predefined values: Low, Medium, High

steps.action: Navigate to task creation page
steps.expectedResult: Task creation form is displayed with all required fields including a priority dropdown field

steps.action: Click on the priority dropdown to view available options
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown expands and displays all allowed priority levels: Low, Medium, and High

steps.action: Select 'Low' priority from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Low priority is selected and displayed in the dropdown field without any validation errors

steps.action: Fill in other required task fields (task name, description, assignee, deadline)
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept valid input without errors

steps.action: Submit the form by clicking the Create/Save button
steps.expectedResult: Task is created successfully with Low priority, confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the priority is displayed in task details view
steps.expectedResult: Task details page shows 'Low' priority clearly with appropriate visual indicator (color, icon, or label)

steps.action: Navigate back to task creation page and create another task with 'Medium' priority
steps.expectedResult: Task is created successfully with Medium priority displayed correctly in task details and list

steps.action: Create a third task with 'High' priority
steps.expectedResult: Task is created successfully with High priority displayed correctly in task details and list

steps.action: Navigate to task list view and verify all three tasks
steps.expectedResult: All tasks are displayed in the list with their respective priority levels (Low, Medium, High) clearly visible and correctly formatted

postconditions: Three tasks are successfully created with different priority levels
Each priority level is correctly stored in the database
Priority levels are visible in both task details and list views
Priority indicators are displayed consistently across all views

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid priority values
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
User has API access credentials or testing tool configured
API endpoint POST /api/tasks is accessible
Valid authentication token is available
API testing tool (Postman, curl, or similar) is set up

steps.action: Prepare API request payload with valid task data but invalid priority value (e.g., 'Critical', 'Urgent', or numeric value like '1')
steps.expectedResult: API request payload is properly formatted with invalid priority value

steps.action: Send POST request to /api/tasks endpoint with the invalid priority value
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 400 Bad Request status code

steps.action: Examine the API response body
steps.expectedResult: Response contains validation error message indicating that priority value is invalid and lists allowed values (Low, Medium, High)

steps.action: Verify that no task was created in the database
steps.expectedResult: Task list or database query confirms no new task was created with invalid priority

steps.action: Attempt API request with empty priority value
steps.expectedResult: API returns validation error indicating priority is required or defaults to a valid value based on business rules

steps.action: Attempt API request with null priority value
steps.expectedResult: API returns validation error or handles null appropriately according to business rules

steps.action: Send API request with valid priority value (e.g., 'High') to confirm API is functioning
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 201 Created status, task is created successfully with valid priority

postconditions: No tasks are created with invalid priority values
API validation prevents data integrity issues
System maintains only allowed priority values in database
Error messages provide clear guidance on valid priority values

testCases.title: Validate updating task priority with valid values
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
User has permission to edit tasks
At least one task exists in the system with an assigned priority
Task edit page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to an existing task with 'Low' priority and open the task edit page
steps.expectedResult: Task edit form is displayed with current task details showing 'Low' priority selected in the dropdown

steps.action: Click on the priority dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown expands showing all priority options (Low, Medium, High) with 'Low' currently selected

steps.action: Change the priority from 'Low' to 'High'
steps.expectedResult: High priority is selected in the dropdown without validation errors

steps.action: Submit the form by clicking the Update/Save button
steps.expectedResult: Task is updated successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and priority change is saved

steps.action: Verify the updated priority in task details view
steps.expectedResult: Task details page now shows 'High' priority with appropriate visual indicator, replacing the previous 'Low' priority

steps.action: Navigate to task list view
steps.expectedResult: The updated task displays 'High' priority in the list view with correct formatting and visual indicator

steps.action: Edit the same task again and change priority to 'Medium'
steps.expectedResult: Priority is successfully updated to 'Medium' and displayed correctly in all views

postconditions: Task priority is successfully updated in the system
Previous priority value is replaced with the new valid priority
Updated priority is visible to all authorized users in all views
Priority change is reflected immediately without requiring page refresh

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view tasks sorted by priority and deadline to achieve better workload planning

testCases.title: Validate sorting tasks by priority
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
Manager has authorization to view tasks
Task database contains multiple tasks with varying priorities (High, Medium, Low)
At least 10 tasks exist in the system for meaningful sorting validation
Browser is supported and JavaScript is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the task list page by clicking on 'Tasks' menu item or accessing the task list URL
steps.expectedResult: Task list page loads successfully within 3 seconds, displaying all tasks with their priority levels visible

steps.action: Locate the sorting options dropdown or button and select 'Sort by Priority' option
steps.expectedResult: System processes the sorting request and tasks are reordered from High to Low priority (High priority tasks appear first, followed by Medium, then Low)

steps.action: Verify the task order by examining the priority column or labels for each task in the displayed list
steps.expectedResult: All High priority tasks are grouped at the top, followed by all Medium priority tasks, then all Low priority tasks. No tasks are out of sequence within their priority groups

steps.action: Scroll through the entire task list to confirm consistent sorting throughout
steps.expectedResult: Priority sorting is maintained throughout the entire list with no exceptions or errors

postconditions: Task list remains sorted by priority
Sorting preference is persisted for the manager's session
No data is modified or lost
System performance remains within acceptable limits

testCases.title: Validate filtering tasks by assignee
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
Manager has authorization to view and filter tasks
Multiple tasks exist in the system assigned to different employees
At least one employee has multiple tasks assigned
Employee assignee list is populated and accessible
Browser is supported and JavaScript is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the task list page by clicking on 'Tasks' menu item or accessing the task list URL
steps.expectedResult: Task list page loads successfully within 3 seconds, displaying all tasks with assignee information visible

steps.action: Locate the filter options section and click on the 'Filter by Assignee' dropdown or filter control
steps.expectedResult: Assignee filter dropdown opens displaying a list of all employees who have tasks assigned to them

steps.action: Select a specific employee from the assignee dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: System applies the filter and task list updates immediately to show only tasks assigned to the selected employee

steps.action: Verify that all displayed tasks show the selected employee as the assignee
steps.expectedResult: All tasks in the filtered list display the selected employee's name in the assignee field. No tasks assigned to other employees are visible

steps.action: Check the task count or summary information to confirm the number of filtered tasks
steps.expectedResult: Task count reflects only the filtered tasks and matches the actual number of tasks displayed for the selected assignee

postconditions: Task list displays only filtered results
Filter preference is persisted for the manager's session
Original task data remains unchanged
Filter can be cleared to return to full task list view
System performance remains within acceptable limits

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to modify task deadlines and priorities to adapt to changing project needs

testCases.title: Validate successful update of deadline and priority
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
Manager has authorization to edit tasks
At least one task exists in the system that can be edited
Task has an assignee configured
Notification system is operational
Current date and time are known for validation purposes
Browser is supported and JavaScript is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the task list page and locate a specific task to edit
steps.expectedResult: Task list page displays with all tasks visible and accessible

steps.action: Click on the task or select the 'Edit' button/icon for the chosen task
steps.expectedResult: Task edit form is displayed showing current task details including existing deadline and priority values

steps.action: Modify the deadline field by selecting a valid future date (at least 1 day from current date)
steps.expectedResult: Date picker allows selection of future date and the field updates with the new date value. No validation errors are displayed

steps.action: Modify the priority field by selecting a different valid priority level (High, Medium, or Low)
steps.expectedResult: Priority dropdown allows selection and the field updates with the new priority value. No validation errors are displayed

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Submit' button to save the changes
steps.expectedResult: Form submits successfully, processing completes within 2 seconds, and a success message is displayed confirming the task has been updated

steps.action: Verify the task details in the task list or task detail view reflect the updated deadline and priority
steps.expectedResult: Task displays the new deadline and priority values correctly in all views

steps.action: Check that a notification was sent to the task assignee (verify in notification log or assignee's notification inbox)
steps.expectedResult: Notification is successfully sent to the assignee informing them of the task updates, including the new deadline and priority

postconditions: Task deadline and priority are updated in the database
Updated values are reflected in all task views
Assignee has received notification of changes
Task modification is logged in audit trail
No data corruption or loss occurred
System remains stable and responsive

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid deadline during edit
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
Manager has authorization to edit tasks
At least one task exists in the system that can be edited
Current date and time are known for validation purposes
Client-side and server-side validation are enabled
Browser is supported and JavaScript is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the task list page and locate a specific task to edit
steps.expectedResult: Task list page displays with all tasks visible and accessible

steps.action: Click on the task or select the 'Edit' button/icon for the chosen task
steps.expectedResult: Task edit form is displayed showing current task details including the deadline field

steps.action: Modify the deadline field by selecting or entering a past date (any date before the current date)
steps.expectedResult: Date field updates with the past date value

steps.action: Click outside the deadline field or tab to the next field to trigger validation
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed near the deadline field indicating 'Deadline cannot be set to a past date' or similar error message. The field may be highlighted in red or with an error indicator

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form by clicking the 'Save' or 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and prevented. Error message remains visible or is re-displayed. Focus may return to the invalid deadline field. No data is saved to the database

steps.action: Verify that the task retains its original deadline value by canceling the edit or checking the task details
steps.expectedResult: Original task deadline remains unchanged in the database and task views. No updates were applied

postconditions: Task deadline remains unchanged with original value
No invalid data is saved to the database
Error message is clearly communicated to the user
Form remains in edit mode allowing correction
No notifications are sent to assignees
System remains stable with no errors logged
